definition[0]: to fill something with air or gas so it becomes larger, or to become filled with air or gas
example[0]: It took us half an hour to inflate the dinghy.
example[1]: Her life jacket failed to inflate.
definition[1]: to make something seem more important or impressive than it really is
example[2]: The success further inflated his self-confidence.
example[3]: The numbers of people involved have been grossly inflated by the media.
definition[2]: to increase in price, or to make something increase in price
example[4]: Hotels often inflate prices at particular times of the year.
definition[3]: if the cost or level of something inflates or is inflated, it increases, often above what is reasonable or normal
example[6]: Overseas sales were inflated by the depreciation of the yen.
example[7]: Costs of bringing crops to market are likely to inflate due to the high price of oil.
